1.title: Anyone can be President
1.plot: Kingsley discusses how anyone can be president, which is why Donald Trump is in the white house. He then goes to interview kids on what they would do if they were president.

2.title: Made in Chyna
2.plot: Kingsley dishes about Blac Chyna, and how she is responsible for helping Rob Kardashian come out of his shell. Thanks, Blac Chyna.

3.title: Minority TV
3.plot: Finally. Like, finally. Why has it taken so long for television to start reflecting what modern America really looks like? Join Kingsley and the gang for a look at the best TV shows featuring compelling minority characters and stories. Madea is shaking things up with a janky new game, and the Mess Hall is all about #EarnMe.

4.title: Hacking
4.plot: Kingsley discusses the internet, and how it is becoming toxic to our society. According to Kingsley, getting hacked is a nightmare. He goes on to talk about the different celebrities that have been hacked.

5.title: Porm
5.plot: Kingsley discusses how the 21st century has changed porn forever.

6.title: Goodbye Obama
6.plot: Breaking up is hard. Breaking up with the Obama's is just...nope. Lady Liberty (AKA Kingsley) takes us through that devastating process. But it's not all bad. Barak finally gets to enjoy retirement: Stephanie predicts lots of weed, Grant sees a mix tape with Biden in his future, and Kingsley sees poolside Pokemon Go becoming an Obama staple.

7.title: One Night Stands
7.plot: Kingsley discusses the evolution of one night stands and how they've evolved over time, with dating apps now available to everyone.

8.title: Strange Fads
8.plot: Kingsley goes over strange fads, and how celebrities are mostly responsible for creating them. From Kylie Jenner's lip kit challenge to pumpkin spice lattes, to vaping.

9.title: Disaster Diets
9.plot: Kingsley goes over the worst diets of all time which include tapeworm diets, the abdominal muscle belt, the purple diet, shake-weight, etc. The cast then tests out these diet/exercise products.

10.title: Marriage
10.plot: Kingsley goes over celebrity marriages, and how we as a society focus so much on relationships that we aren't even a part of.

11.title: Celebrity Comebacks
11.plot: It's hard to keep tabs on who's here, who's gone, and who's back. We're talking about celebrity comebacks. Kingsley defines a "comeback", shares his favs, and laments those who should have never come back. How does Nick Cage do it: eternally back, forever gone. King enlists Shanna, Grant and some furry friends to help him sort out the mess.

12.title: Money
12.plot: Money seems to bring out the worst in people...on Instagram...who post about it. Bye. But they can't totally ruin money for the rest of us, at least not when we can get our hands on it. With a minimum wage $7.25 in America, it's no wonder people are obsessed with stacking that green. Kingsley sends Grant and Shanna out with an hours wage to get supplies for a hot date: how much can you really buy with that kind of money?

13.title: Celebrity Fueds
13.plot: What could possibly be more enthralling than following the life of a celebrity? How about following the drama of two celebrities? Kingsley and the Mess Hall dive into the weirdness of celebrity feuds (turns out Grant has a feud of his own brewing with a celebrity!) then Shanna and Stephanie battle it out in the ultimate cat-lebrity feud.

14.title: Subreddits
14.plot: What started as a simple way for users to share thoughts and news, has somehow turned into a photoshopped zoo of mutated memes and gifs. That's right, subreddits. Other than being a time vacuum, they are generally harmless, but none the less horrifying. Join Kingsley, Grant, Shanna and Stephanie has they discuss their favorite subreddits, and discover the beauty that is Slav Squatting.

15.title: Weed
15.plot: Kingsley Stephanie and Grant discuss their craziest experiences with weed.

16.title: Technology
16.plot: That age old question (for anyone under 25), "Is technology ruining our lives??" It's all many of us have ever know; computers, laptops, smartphones, apps - They seem to affect everything we do. Is that awesome or terrifying? Kingsley's workout technology gets sassy with him, Grant can't get off his phone, and Stephanie has blue lipstick? Sigh The future.

17.title: Body Shaming
17.plot: It's disgusting. No, not Leo's dad bod, don't be mean, but BODY SHAMING. What is up with that? Join Kingsley as he shames on body shaming, and the Mess Hall as they filter through the swap that is body shaming drama. Then, Kingsley, Shanna and Stephanie face off to try to take the ugliest selfie - by whatever means necessary.

18.title: Award Shows
18.plot: Show of hands, who's already practised their Academy Awards acceptance speech in the mirror? Great. Watch Kingsley as he gets bombarded with on-the-spot acceptance speeches from total strangers on the street, then the Mess Hall tackles the highs and lows of awards shows.

19.title: Star Wars
19.plot: Kingsley has a dark side: his hatred for the space series that has been in our lives since 1977: Star Wars. Can a Star Wars character make-over and runway show change his mind? It might take more than a feather boa and some rhinestones to convince Kingsley that this isn't just a load of intergalactic crap.

20.title: Too Cool for School
20.plot: Grant and Kingsley get hands on education at a farm, and get the answers to some of life's deepest questions like, "where does the term 'camel toe' come from"? But what is the real process, purpose, value, and price of getting a good education these days? Is college everything it's cracked up to be? Join Kingsley and the Mess Hall as they work it all out.

21.title: Drag the World
21.plot: Kingsley discusses drag, and how it has evolved into mainstream media over time. He then competes in a drag show with Stephanie.

22.title: Climate Change
22.plot: If we loved Mother Nature like we love Beyonce; oh what a different world we would be living in. From the inner workings of politics all the way down to Joe Shmoe deciding whether or not to recycle his water bottle, climate care is not looking good. Kingsley, Grant, Shanna and Stephanie get sweet treats to illustrate the sad state of the planet, and things get green in the Mess Hall.

23.title: Political Sex Scandals
23.plot: Kingsley dishes over the most memorable and absurd political sex scandals of our time.

24.title: Elon Musk
24.plot: The man, the self-driving cars, the mansion on Mars? Elon Musk is transforming our everyday lives into full-on Jetsons mode. Kingsley takes to the streets of Hollywood to find out what celebrities people would ship off to Mars to start the first human colony there. Then the Mess Hall tries to predict what Elon will do next to launch our world into the future.

imdb.plot outline: An absurd, irreverent news and comedy sketch show for the meme generation, We Got Issues uses hilariously demented hyper-visuals and devices to explode the ridiculous, mock-worthy, surreal and the downright dumb ass in this weeks news and all its players.
imdb.title: We Got Issues
plot: An absurd, irreverent news and comedy sketch show for the meme generation, _We Got Issues_ (qv) uses hilariously demented hyper-visuals and devices to explode the ridiculous, mock-worthy, surreal and the downright dumb ass in this weeks news and all its players.
